Name: Relief fragment of Amenhotep
Description: This relief fragment comes from the lower section of a tomb wall. The figures were executed in raised relief, the hieroglyphs were carved.Only 3 cm of the scene in the upper register remains. The traces indicate that it was similar to the scene in the register below: a couple is sitting on a chair with leonine legs and low backrest in front of a low offering table with several offerings on it. Facing them is a man who is pouring liquid from a hes-vase onto the offering table. Under the chair is a monkey.The area above the scene in the lower register was filled with six columns of inscription: the offering formula and captions.
